item.description:
The Topsfield Town Library is hosting "Edible Wild Plants of the Northeast", a comprehensive introduction to the identification and uses of wild plants for food and beverage by John Root. This 90-minute power point presentation features distinguishing characteristics, seasons of availability, habitats, methods of preparation, and nutritional value of our region's most common and appealing wild plants. Questions and comments are welcome throughout the presentation.

 Food samples are offered to participants, and illustrated pamphlets with plant descriptions, guidelines for responsible and safe foraging, and a bibliography for further study are distributed as well.

For more information visit www.johnroot.net and www.topsfieldtownlibrary.org
item.name: Edible Wild Plants of the Northeast
